did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: A collection of over 10,000 menus, providing evidence of the manners, mores, and food habits of earlier times.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The core of the collection was assembled by Oscar Tschirky (1866-1943), known throughout the world as Oscar of the Waldorf. As maitre d'hotel of the Waldorf Astoria Hotel in New York City, from 1893 to 1943, he began a lifelong hobby of collecting menus, some of which were for functions he himself arranged, but most of which were of historical, gastronomic, or artistic importance. Upon his death, his menu collection, papers, and personal memorabilia were donated to Cornell University. The Hotel School Library has continued to add to the collection.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: A collection of over 10,000 menus, providing evidence of the manners, mores, and food habits of earlier times.

Many menus include prints or half-tones of historic people and places. They may also include featured speakers, detail organizational leadership, and provide biographical sketches of the famous and infamous, including Theodore Roosevelt, Wilbur and Orville Wright, and Oscar Hammerstein. They may dramatize historical events, such as a "luncheon to the California Promotion Committee on the occasion of the resumption of the hotel business in the burned district after the earthquake and fire on 18 April 1906"; the opening of the first tunnels of the Hudson and Manhattan Railroad Company under the Hudson River; and a dinner in honor of Louis Kossuth, the Hungarian patriot. Prohibition era menus indicated the availability of spirits to their clientele by tucking a small insert into the spine cord of the menu.
Also menus collected by Charles N. Pinco.
Also, menus collected by Ruth Wood Green from hotels and nightclubs in the 1940s.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Menu Collection, #6452. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIAL
relatedmaterial.p: Database at The Nestlé Library Restaurant Menus Database
See also the volume titled The Charles N. Pinco collection of international restaurant menus : gathered between 1909 and 1958 from the major portion of the civilized world, call # TX728.P56 + .

did.unittitle: Beaux Arts Ball Carte des Vins, Hotel Astor
The Beeches Restaurant and Paul Revere Lodge
Boston Bicentennial Luncheon Honoring Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II and Hist Royal Highness the Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh

scopecontent.p: A bicentennial celebration of the Revolutionary War hosted by the mayor of Boston, Kevin H. White, at the Boston City Hall. The document includes the program of the event, the menu, and a guestlist. Finally, at the end of the document, there is a note that reads, "On July 11, in the year of America's Bicentennial, 1976, Her Majesty, Queen Elizabeth II and His Royal Highness The Prince Philip, Duke of Edinburgh, visited these Freedom Trail sites in Boston. Two hundred years after voices of liberty echoed through this historic city, we celebrate the strong friendship now shared by Boston and Great Britain."

did.unittitle: Hal's Guide to Great Sandwiches and other Gustatory Delights
Hawthorne by the Sea, Dessert Menu

scopecontent.p: Lists several locations in Massachusetts

This document is really several stapled together. There are multiple wine lists, and two letters to customers. The first, from November 14th, 1940, tells us that Hearns has been able to gather together a great quantity of French wine, which is now impossible due to the war. Apparently, "this is probably the most outstanding achievement in the history of 'America's Largest Liquor Store.'" The next letter, from 1942, describes its liquor as "safe from the ruthless hands of the invaders."
This menue comes from the 1964-65 World's Fair.

did.unittitle: Hilltop Steakhouse, A panorama Tour of

scopecontent.p: A pamphlet meant to give its reader a tour of the restaurant. Special attention is paid to the dining rooms, facilities, and ample parking.
